etymologies: mid 19th century: from German Tridymit, from Greek tridumos ‘threefold’, from tri- ‘three’ + -dumos (as in didumos ‘twin’), because of its occurrence in groups of three crystals

definitions: a high-temperature form of quartz found as thin hexagonal crystals in some igneous rocks and stony meteorites.
shortDefinitions: high-temperature form of quartz found as thin hexagonal crystals in some igneous rocks
